channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Opinion: Disqualified but not forgotten
item.description: A Ukrainian athlete was disqualified from competition this week by the International Olympic Committee because his helmet had images of other Ukrainian athletes killed in Russia's war on his country.
item.content:encoded:
A Ukrainian athlete was disqualified from competition this week by the International Olympic Committee because his helmet had images of other Ukrainian athletes killed in Russia's war on his country.

(Image credit: Al Bello/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: It's a dangerous complication of pregnancy -- but a new drug holds promise
item.description: Researchers celebrate early results of a drug that may become the first treatment for a serious complication of pregnancy called preeclampsia. It's got the potential to save many lives.
item.content:encoded:
Researchers celebrate early results of a drug that may become the first treatment for a serious complication of pregnancy called preeclampsia. It's got the potential to save many lives.

(Image credit: Tommy Trenchard for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Meet the power couples of the 2026 Winter Games, from rivals to teammates
item.description: Some of these power couples span multiple sports, while others compete in the same discipline — or even on the same team.
item.content:encoded:
Some of these power couples span multiple sports, while others compete in the same discipline — or even on the same team.











(Image credit: Michael Steele)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: After a 2-decade ban, kites fill Lahore's skies during a Pakistani springtime festival
item.description: People gathered on rooftops to enjoy flying kites for the first time in years, celebrating the spring festival of Basant. The activity had been banned due to injuries and deaths during past celebrations.
item.content:encoded:
People gathered on rooftops to enjoy flying kites for the first time in years, celebrating the spring festival of Basant. The activity had been banned due to injuries and deaths during past celebrations.

(Image credit: Betsy Joles for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Betsy Joles

item.title: ChatGPT promised to help her find her soulmate. Then it betrayed her
item.description: ChatGPT sent screenwriter Micky Small down a fantastical rabbit hole. Now, she's finding her way out.
item.content:encoded:
ChatGPT sent screenwriter Micky Small down a fantastical rabbit hole. Now, she's finding her way out.

(Image credit: Courtney Theophin)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: Under oath and unredacted: The top political stories on Epstein this week
item.description: Attorney General Pam Bondi faced pointed questions on Capitol Hill, and lawmakers continued to press the Justice Department about its decision to redact certain information.
item.content:encoded:
Attorney General Pam Bondi faced pointed questions on Capitol Hill, and lawmakers continued to press the Justice Department about its decision to redact certain information.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Saige Miller

item.title: Dr. Oz pushes AI avatars as a fix for rural health care. Not so fast, critics say
item.description: Dr. Mehmet Oz, who heads the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, is advancing a $50 billion plan to modernize rural health care.
item.content:encoded:
Dr. Mehmet Oz, who heads the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, is advancing a $50 billion plan to modernize rural health care.

(Image credit: Heather Diehl)
item.dc:creator: Windsor Johnston

item.title: Rubio reassures trans-Atlantic ties with Europe at Munich Security Conference
item.description: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio delivered a calm and reassuring message to America's allies in Munich, after more than a year of President Donald Trump's often-hostile rhetoric toward allies.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio delivered a calm and reassuring message to America's allies in Munich, after more than a year of President Donald Trump's often-hostile rhetoric toward allies.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 5 things to know about the shutdown at the Department of Homeland Security
item.description: The sprawling agency saw its baseline funding expire after lawmakers left town for a week-long recess, but without a deal to rein in the conduct of federal immigration officers.
item.content:encoded:
The sprawling agency saw its baseline funding expire after lawmakers left town for a week-long recess, but without a deal to rein in the conduct of federal immigration officers.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Ilia Malinin, U.S. figure skater favored for gold, finishes 8th
item.description: Malinin, undefeated since 2023, stumbled and fell multiple times, landing far off the podium. Mikhail Shaidorov of Kazakhstan won gold in an upset that shocked even himself.
item.content:encoded:
Malinin, undefeated since 2023, stumbled and fell multiple times, landing far off the podium. Mikhail Shaidorov of Kazakhstan won gold in an upset that shocked even himself.

(Image credit: Andreas Rentz)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman
